definition: to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
to plan/to seek/scheme
money/wealth/riches/property/valuables
to do harm to/to cause trouble to/harm/evil/calamity
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: Wasting other people's time is tantamount to robbery or murder.
sentences.chinese: 浪費別人的時間就等於謀財害命。

sentences.english: Sinclair marries wealthy men and murders them for inheritance.
sentences.chinese: 辛克萊會嫁給有錢人，然後謀財害命。

sentences.english: The detective reasoned that David had been murdered for his money.
sentences.chinese: 偵探推斷戴維被人謀財害命了。

definition: lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]
to be devoid of all humanity/inhuman/bestial
evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
red in the face/extremely angry
to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to imitate the dog and steal chicken (idiom)/to pilfer/to dally with women/to have affairs
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
Heaven knows!
stupid and ignorant (idiom)
